intro: Vochysia bautistae, commonly known as the Bautista's velvetwood, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a vital role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
